page.title: 09Watersports Centre
page.content: The{Nottinghamshire County Council owns the 270 acre site which is the {Holme Pierrepont Watersports Centre. The old gravel workings were transformed into the Centre which was opened in 1973. If the 1992 Olympic Games are held in Britain, the rowing and canoeing events will take place at Holme Pierrepont. There is a large rectangular stretch of water which is 2,125 metres long and 135 metres wide. There is special equipment for starting races, an electronic scoreboard and electronic timing equipment. There is a stand for spectators but people can also sit on the grass along the side. At the end of he course is a large boathouse where the various craft used on the water can be kept. Local organisations use the facilities which are also the venue for regattas.
